pullRequest.body:
The definition of `Subfield.closure` is changed to use `sInf` like many substructures. In the commutative case (at the end of the file), it's shown to be equal to the original version, renamed to `commClosure`, in the new lemma `commClosure_eq_closure`. No lemma is removed, and all lemma statements remain the same.

I do not change the name `Subfield` to `SubdivisionRing` as this kind of name abuse is accepted practice in mathlib, and since a division ring is also called a skew field.

Also generalizes `RingHom.eqLocus(Field)` slightly.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

nodes.body: I assume this is essentially a port of https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/8919 ?
Which raises: does `IntermediateField` deserve the same generalization?

Indeed this is super similar to the work you've already done 2 years ago! @jcommelin thought it should be named `Subdivisionring` (or `SubdivisionRing`?) but changing the name would require fixing a lot of files, or maybe we can make an alias / abbrev Subfield for the commutative case, which would also make it less awkward for most of the people who will only work with fields.

Generalizing `IntermediateField` is a good idea too, as (maximal) subfields in central simple algebras (e.g. quaternion algebras) are important in number theory, for example. However, ~~this only warrant a generalization to IntermediateFields between a Field and a DivisionRing, not two DivisionRings~~ (Edit: generalizing to two DivisionRings isn't immediately possible, because of the `Algebra` typeclass involved), and we probably want to bake in commutativity, so maybe a dedicated type for maximal subfields is more appropriate. On the other hand, people do study extension of division rings and even their Galois theory, and a fully generalized IntermediateField might be more applicable in that case. I would be happy to see the generalization done in another PR, and hopefully it only incurs minimal changes.

LGTM, but maybe make the `commClosure` decl private, as you suggest.

bors d+

LGTM, but maybe make the `commClosure` decl private, as you suggest.

bors d+
Is this a change? Can you either revert it, mention it in the commit message, or move it to it's own PR?
Yeah I've add it to the commit message. It's a rather trivial generalization (Ring to Semiring). I simply saw an opportunity to generalize `eqLocusField` which requires generalizing this too.
I'm not convinced this is the right design; we don't have this for any other subject yet, right? I think I'd prefer to see it in a separate PR

I can make this private if you want; it's just a convenient definition to prove `mem_closure_iff` in the commutative case. It turns out people have only been using `mem_closure_iff` rather than the definition of `closure` throughout mathlib, and that's why this refactor needs to fix no other files. (If it's made private then `commClosure_eq_closure` will also be private.)

```suggestion
private def commClosure (s : Set K) : Subfield K where
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: Subfield of DivisionRing, not just Field
